intro: Amanoa acuminata, commonly known as the slender amanoa, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
